intro: Tibouchina canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, violet or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, white hairs that give it a distinctive silvery appearance. Tibouchina canescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
